camera_modifier_screen.title: Camera modifier screen
camera_modifier_screen.normal_modifier.t: Double-click an element to move it into the priority queue
Only one is valid, obtain according to priority
camera_modifier_screen.player_order.tip1: Double-click an element to move it out of the priority queue
camera_modifier_screen.player_order.tip2: Select an element and press the up or down key to change the order
camera_modifier_screen.background_modifi: Double-click an element to delete it
Double-click an element to restore it
commands.apertureapi.play.description: Play a camera path with optional speed and loop settings
commands.apertureapi.play.native.failure: Animation is not a native path:
gui.camera_anim.point_setting.tip: Double-click to move item; use interpolation settings for detailed control
gui.camera_anim.interpolation_setting.ea: Starts slow and speeds up near the end.
Starts fast and slows down near the end.
Starts slow, speeds up, then slows down at the end.
camera_anim.motion_interpolator.linear.t: Moves in a straight line between points.
camera_anim.time_interpolator.linear.too: Changes at a constant rate over time.
camera_anim.time_interpolator.bezier.too: Use handles to control the timing curve (ease in/out).
path.interpolation.linear.tooltip: Straight-line motion between keyframes. Sharp, precise movement.
path.interpolation.cosine.tooltip: Smooth cosine interpolation with gentle acceleration/deceleration.
path.interpolation.hermite.tooltip: Cubic Hermite splines with tension, continuity, and bias controls.
path.interpolation.bezier.tooltip: Cubic Bezier curves with full handle control for custom paths.
path.interpolation.catmull_uniform.toolt: Uniform Catmull-Rom spline (α=0). May create loops on sharp turns.
path.interpolation.catmull_centripetal.t: Centripetal Catmull-Rom spline (α=0.5). Prevents loops and cusps - best for camera work.
path.interpolation.catmull_chordal.toolt: Chordal Catmull-Rom spline (α=1.0). Tighter curves, may overshoot.
path.easing.quad_in.tooltip: Quadratic ease-in: starts slow, accelerates smoothly.
path.easing.quad_out.tooltip: Quadratic ease-out: starts fast, decelerates smoothly.
path.easing.quad_in_out.tooltip: Quadratic ease in-out: slow start and end, fast middle.
path.easing.cubic_in.tooltip: Cubic ease-in: very slow start with strong acceleration.
path.easing.cubic_out.tooltip: Cubic ease-out: fast start with strong deceleration.
path.easing.cubic_in_out.tooltip: Cubic ease in-out: smooth acceleration and deceleration. Best for camera work.
path.easing.quart_in.tooltip: Quartic ease-in: extremely slow start, sharp acceleration.
path.easing.quart_out.tooltip: Quartic ease-out: sharp start, extremely slow end.
path.easing.quart_in_out.tooltip: Quartic ease in-out: very slow start/end, sharp middle transition.
path.easing.quint_in.tooltip: Quintic ease-in: ultra-slow start with dramatic acceleration.
path.easing.quint_out.tooltip: Quintic ease-out: dramatic start with ultra-slow end.
path.easing.quint_in_out.tooltip: Quintic ease in-out: ultra-slow start/end with dramatic middle.
path.easing.sine_in.tooltip: Sinusoidal ease-in: gentle, organic acceleration curve.
path.easing.sine_out.tooltip: Sinusoidal ease-out: gentle, organic deceleration curve.
path.easing.sine_in_out.tooltip: Sinusoidal ease in-out: very smooth, natural feeling transitions.
path.easing.expo_in.tooltip: Exponential ease-in: extremely slow start, explosive acceleration.
path.easing.expo_out.tooltip: Exponential ease-out: explosive start, extremely slow end.
path.easing.expo_in_out.tooltip: Exponential ease in-out: explosive middle transition.
path.easing.circ_in.tooltip: Circular ease-in: follows circular arc, slow start.
path.easing.circ_out.tooltip: Circular ease-out: follows circular arc, slow end.
path.easing.circ_in_out.tooltip: Circular ease in-out: circular arc transitions.
path.easing.back_in.tooltip: Back ease-in: overshoots backwards before moving forward.
path.easing.back_out.tooltip: Back ease-out: overshoots target before settling.
path.easing.back_in_out.tooltip: Back ease in-out: overshoots at both start and end.
path.easing.elastic_in.tooltip: Elastic ease-in: spring-like oscillation before acceleration.
path.easing.elastic_out.tooltip: Elastic ease-out: spring-like oscillation after reaching target.
path.easing.elastic_in_out.tooltip: Elastic ease in-out: spring oscillations at both ends.
path.easing.bounce_in.tooltip: Bounce ease-in: bouncing motion before reaching speed.
path.easing.bounce_out.tooltip: Bounce ease-out: bouncing motion when reaching target.
path.easing.bounce_in_out.tooltip: Bounce ease in-out: bouncing at both start and end.
path.speed.duration.tooltip: Path completes in fixed time regardless of length. Variable speed.
path.speed.blocks_per_second.tooltip: Constant speed in blocks/second. Duration varies with path length.
path.banking.enabled.tooltip: Automatically rolls camera into turns like an airplane or vehicle.
path.banking.strength.tooltip: How much the camera rolls into turns (0.0 = none, 2.0 = extreme).
path.banking.roll_mix.tooltip: Blend between keyframed roll and banking roll (0.0 = keyframes only, 1.0 = banking only).
path.follow.entity.tooltip: Camera automatically looks at a specific entity.
path.follow.block.tooltip: Camera automatically looks at a fixed world position.
path.follow.speed.tooltip: How quickly camera orientation changes to track target (1.0 = instant, 0.1 = slow).
path.arc_length.title: Arc-Length Parameterization
path.arc_length.tooltip: Ensures constant speed playback regardless of keyframe spacing.
path.arc_length.samples.tooltip: Number of samples for arc-length calculation. Higher = more accurate but slower.
commands.camera.interpolation.tooltip: Change interpolation type for a camera path.
commands.camera.speed.duration.tooltip: Set fixed duration for path playback in seconds.
commands.camera.speed.blocks.tooltip: Set constant speed in blocks per second.
commands.camera.follow.tooltip: Make camera automatically look at entity or position.
commands.camera.easing.tooltip: Change timing curve for smooth acceleration/deceleration.
commands.camera.visualization.tooltip: Show/hide path preview, handles, and debug info.
commands.camera.migrate.tooltip: Convert old format paths to new Path System v2.
commands.camera.test.tooltip: Generate a demonstration path with CMDCam-style interpolation.
commands.camera.debug.tooltip: Show detailed information about path evaluation at specific time.
commands.camera.play.tooltip: Play a camera path. Defaults: speed=1.0x (normal), loop=false (play once).
commands.camera.play.speed.tooltip: Playback speed multiplier (0.05x to 10.0x). 1.0 = normal speed.
commands.camera.play.loop.tooltip: Whether to loop the path continuously. Default: false (play once).
commands.camera.stop.tooltip: Stop the currently playing camera path with smooth fade-out.
gui.path.timeline.title: Camera Path Timeline
gui.path.timeline.tooltip: Visual timeline for keyframe editing and path preview.
gui.path.keyframe.add.tooltip: Add new keyframe at current camera position and orientation.
gui.path.preview.play.tooltip: Preview camera path animation in real-time.
gui.path.preview.stop.tooltip: Stop preview and return to start position.
gui.path.loop.enabled.tooltip: Path will seamlessly loop from end back to start.
gui.path.outside_mode.tooltip: Generate camera positions outside the keyframe bounds for smoother entry/exit.
gui.path.visualization.path.tooltip: Display the camera path as a 3D curve in the world.
gui.path.visualization.keyframes.tooltip: Display keyframe positions and orientations as 3D indicators.
gui.path.visualization.handles.tooltip: Display Bezier handles for path control points.
gui.path.visualization.velocity.tooltip: Display velocity vectors along the path for debugging speed.
gui.path.visualization.fov.tooltip: Display field-of-view changes as visual indicators.
gui.path.visualization.roll.tooltip: Display camera roll angles as rotation indicators.
gui.path.export.json_v2.tooltip: Export path in new JSON v2 format with all advanced features.
gui.path.import.json_v1.tooltip: Import legacy JSON v1 path (will be automatically upgraded).
gui.path.import.json_v2.tooltip: Import modern JSON v2 path with full feature support.
gui.path.migration.auto.tooltip: Automatically convert v1 paths to v2 format when loading.
gui.path.migration.warning.tooltip: This path uses old format. Some features may not be available.
gui.path.performance.optimization.toolti: Optimize path for better performance during playback.
gui.path.performance.lut_quality.tooltip: Arc-length lookup table quality. Higher = smoother but uses more memory.
gui.path.performance.adaptive_sampling.t: Automatically adjust sample density based on curve complexity.
help.path_system.title: Path System v2 Help
help.path_system.getting_started.tooltip: Quick guide to creating smooth camera paths with professional interpolation.
help.path_system.interpolation_guide.too: Detailed explanation of each interpolation type and when to use them.
help.path_system.easing_guide.tooltip: Understanding easing for smooth acceleration and deceleration.
help.path_system.banking_guide.tooltip: How to use banking for realistic vehicle-like camera movement.
help.path_system.follow_targets_guide.to: Setting up automatic camera targeting for dynamic shots.
help.path_system.performance_tips.toolti: Optimize your paths for smooth playback and better performance.
warning.path.legacy_format.tooltip: This path uses the old format. Consider migrating to v2 for full features.
warning.path.performance.tooltip: This path may impact performance due to high complexity or sample count.
warning.path.compatibility.tooltip: Some features may not work with older Aperture-API versions.
example.path.linear_flyby.tooltip: Simple straight-line camera movement between two points.
example.path.smooth_orbit.tooltip: Circular camera movement around a central point using Catmull-Rom.
example.path.dramatic_reveal.tooltip: Slow approach with eased acceleration for cinematic reveals.
example.path.banking_turn.tooltip: Vehicle-like camera movement with automatic banking in turns.
example.path.follow_entity.tooltip: Camera path that automatically tracks a moving entity.
tips.interpolation.catmull_rom: Catmull-Rom Centripetal is recommended for most camera work as it prevents loops and cusps.
tips.easing.cubic_in_out: Cubic In-Out easing provides the most natural feeling acceleration and deceleration.
tips.banking.realistic: Use banking strength between 0.5-1.5 for realistic vehicle-like movement.
tips.speed.constant: Use Speed Mode for constant velocity, Duration Mode for timed sequences.
tips.performance.arc_length: Arc-length parameterization ensures smooth playback but requires more computation.
tips.visualization.debug: Enable path visualization to see the actual curve your camera will follow.
